DataElement.preferredName: Person Increase Risk Gastrointestinal Tract Hemorrhage Perforation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person is at increased risk for gastrointestinal hemorrhage, the flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel gastrointestinal tract, or gastrointestinal perforation, a hole or rupture in the gastrointestinal tract, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Increase Risk Gastrointestinal Tract Hemorrhage Perforation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person being at increased risk for gastrointestinal hemorrhage, the flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel gastrointestinal tract, or gastrointestinal perforation, a hole or rupture in the gastrointestinal tract, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Increase Risk Gastrointestinal Tract Hemorrhage Perforation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Increase; a process of becoming larger or more numerous or more important.:Risk is the potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable. (from WIkipedia):The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.:Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.:Perforation; a hole made through a part or substance. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.

The upper gastrointestinal (GI) tract is comprised of mouth, pharynx, esophagus and stomach while the lower GI tract consists of intestines and anus. The primary function of the GI tract is to ingest, digest, absorb and ultimately excrete food stuff.
The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.
A hole or opening made through a membrane or other tissue or material.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have any con
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any condition that may increase the risk of gastrointestinal bleeding or gastrointestinal perforation, including the following: Active peptic ulcer disease Known gastrointestinal intraluminal metastatic lesions (gastrointestinal serosa metastatic lesion are permitted) Inflammatory bowel disease (e.g., ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any condition that may increase the risk of gastrointestinal bleeding or gastrointestinal perforation, including active peptic ulcer disease, known gastrointestinal intraluminal metastatic lesions (gastrointestinal serosa metastatic lesion are permitted), inflammatory bowel disease (e.g. ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any condition that may increase the risk of gastrointestinal bleeding or gastrointestinal perforation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior clinically significant gastrointestinal abnormalities that may increase the risk for gastrointestinal bleeding?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
